org.ireas.mediawiki

Class MediaWikiUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ireas.mediawiki.MediaWikiUtils

  • public final class MediaWikiUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for org.ireas.mediawiki. This class contains helper methods for common operations as closing objects or parsing the API output.

    • Method Detail

      • buildUri

        public static URI buildUri(String scheme,
           String host,
           int port,
           String path)
                    throws MediaWikiException
        Constructs an URI object from scheme, host, port and apiPath. The constructed URI will have the structure "<scheme>://<host>:<port>/<apiPath>".
        Parameters:
        scheme - the scheme of the URI, e. g. "https"
        host - the host of the URI, e. g. "example.org"
        port - the port of the URI, e. g. 443. The port must be non-negative.
        path - the path of the URI, e. g. "/index.html"
        Returns:
        an URI constructed from the given parts
        Throws:
        MediaWikiException - if the given parts do not form a valid URI
        NullPointerException - if scheme, host or path is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if port is negative

      • close

        public static void close(@Nullable
         AutoCloseable closeable)
        Closes closeable (if not null) and ignores any exception thrown closing the object.
        Parameters:
        closeable - the object to close

      • close

        public static void close(AutoCloseable... closeables)
        Closes all objects in closeables and ignores any exceptions thrown closing the objects. All objects will be closed, regardless whether an exception occurs. The given objects may be null.
        Parameters:
        closeables - a list of objects to close. Elements of the list may be null

      • close

        public static void close(Collection<? extends AutoCloseable> closeables)
        Closes all objects in closeables and ignores any exceptions thrown closing the objects. All objects will be closed, regardless whether an exception occurs. The elements in the collection may be null.
        Parameters:
        closeables - a collection of objects to close. Elements of the collection may be null.

      • formatApiDate

        public static String formatApiDate(DateTime date)
        Converts the specified date to a timestamp in the MediaWiki API format and in the UTC time zone.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to convert
        Returns:
        the specified date as a UTC timestamp

      • ignoreException

        public static void ignoreException(@Nullable
                   Exception exception)
        Does nothing to the given exception. May be useful to avoid warnings about empty blocks in catch clauses where an exception is ignored on purpose. Use with care.
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to be ignored

      • mapToNameValuePairs

        public static List<NameValuePair> mapToNameValuePairs(Map<String,String> arguments)
        Constructs a list of NameValuePair objects from arguments.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the map to be converted to a list of NameValuePair objects
        Returns:
        a list of NameValuePair objects constructed from arguments
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if arguments, a key of arguments or a value of arguments is null

      • parseApiTimestamp

        public static DateTime parseApiTimestamp(String timeStamp)
        Parses a timeStamp as returned by the MediaWiki API and returns a Date for that timestamp. MediaWiki API timestamps are in the format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZZ".
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - the API timestamp to parse
        Returns:
        a Date representing the MediaWiki API timeStamp
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if timeStamp is null

      • requireJsonFields

        public static void requireJsonFields(JSONObject object,
                     String... fields)
        Ensures that the specified fields are set in the specified JSON object. If one or more fields are not set, a InvalidResponseException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        object - the JSON object to check
        fields - the required fields
        Throws:
        InvalidResponseException - if one or more of the specified required fields are not present in the specified JSON object

      • requireJsonLength

        public static void requireJsonLength(JSONArray array,
                     int requiredLength)
        Ensures that the specified JSON array has the specified minimum length. If the specified array is too short, a InvalidResponseException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        array - the JSON array to check
        requiredLength - the minimum length of the array
        Throws:
        InvalidResponseException - if the JSON array does not have the specified minimum length
